intro: Capsella acutifolia, commonly known as the sharpleaf catchfly, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of pink or purple flowers with four petals, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing numerous tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Capsella acutifolia is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields.
